summary: This bill, the No Tax Breaks for Union Busting (NTBUB) Act, aims to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to deny tax deductions for employer spending intended to influence employees regarding labor organizations and collective bargaining. It defines relevant terms, outlines specific activities covered, and introduces information reporting requirements with associated penalties for non-compliance. The bill seeks to prevent taxpayer subsidies of employer interference in workers' rights and promote free exercise of collective action.
